title: Battery - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Make sure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame.
This may cause a short circuit or spark which would ignite battery gases.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Warning Rider Configurable Modes (All Models with rider configurable modes SM)
Before disconnecting the battery or removing a fuse for any reason note and record the rider’s settings.
Once the fuse has been refitted or the battery reconnected the rider’s settings should be reset as noted.
If the battery has been disconnected or the fuses removed for any reason, advise the rider to confirm the original mode settings have been correctly set.
Failure to reset the motorcycle to the rider’s preferred rider mode settings and subsequently being ridden, may cause loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DUC; DTB; DUB; TH1; TD1; DS5; DR5; DTC; DU4; DT4; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; YL1; YK1; YJ1; DSB; DSA; DS1; DSX; DC3; DP3; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DUY; DU

body.body: Perform Operations and Seat Removal Link for Service Manual
Remove the positive (+) terminal protective cover to gain access to the fixing.
Take the battery out of the case and remove from the battery sleeve.

search: Battery - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Make sure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame.
This may cause a short circuit or spark which would ignite battery gases.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Before disconnecting the battery or removing a fuse for any reason note and record the rider’s settings.
Once the fuse has been refitted or the battery reconnected the rider’s settings should be reset as noted.
If the battery has been disconnected or the fuses removed for any reason, advise the rider to confirm the original mode settings have been correctly set.
Failure to reset the motorcycle to the rider’s preferred rider mode settings and subsequently being ridden, may cause loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Disconnect the battery negative (black) lead.
Battery
Positive (+) terminal
Negative (-) terminal
Remove the positive (+) terminal protective cover to gain access to the fixing.
Positive (+) terminal cover
Disconnect the battery positive (red) lead.
Remove the battery strap.
Battery strap
Take the battery out of the case and remove from the battery sleeve.
